location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no. 1261 of 1823 from Willian Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Lieutenant Colonel Ephraim Gerrish Stannus

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: Text on the lower part of the page is missing due to insect damage.

mods.abstract: Following the death of Lieutenant John MacLeod on 20 September 1823, Newnham informs Stannus that the Governor in Council places the fullest confidence in his judgement and knowledge of the Gulf. He informs Stannus that the cruizer Aurorawill be ready to convey him to Bushire and that he will be afforded access to instructions issued to MacLeod during his remaining time in Bombay. In addition, he is provided with information concerning his allowances and the employment of native agents.
